item.title: Docker Compose
item.author: Ohmygodzilla
item.description: Docker-Compose … Networking By default Docker-Compose will create a new network for the given compose file. You can change the behavior by defining custom networks in your compose file. Create and assign custom network … Example: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 networks: custom-network: services: app: networks: - custom-network Use existing networks If you want to use an existing Docker network for your compose files, you can add the external: true parameter in your compose file Example:

item.title: Docker Cli
item.author: Ohmygodzilla
item.description: Docker Cheat-Sheet Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-Level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries, and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels. Because all of the containers share the services of a single operating system kernel, they use fewer resources than virtual machines. The service has both free and premium tiers.

item.title: Mariadb Setup
item.author: Ohmygodzilla
item.description: MariaDB Cheat-Sheet Install MariaDB on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS 1 2 3 sudo apt update sudo apt install mariadb-server sudo mysql_secure_installation Access Database from outside Open /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf and change the bind-address to: 1 bind-address = 0.0.0.0 Create Administrative User Create a new user newuser for the host localhost with a new password: 1 CREATE USER 'newuser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'password'; Grant all permissions to the new user 1 GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON * .
